entry.title: Block size following technological growth
entry.summary: On August 6, 2015, Gavin Andresen responded to a comment from Pieter Wuille on Bitcoin-dev regarding competition for block space. Andresen stated that competition for block space is good and what is bad is artificially limiting or centrally controlling the supply of that space. Wuille questioned why competition for block space is considered good and what specific design goal it achieves. The context includes a PGP signature for authenticity.
